column4: ok guys, I have just installed the propriety AMD catalyst control drivers from AMD directly.. however lspci -k | grep VGA still says I am using 03:00.0 VGA compatible controller: Advanced Micro Devices [AMD] nee ATI Barts PRO [ATI Radeon HD 6800 Series]   <-- which is still the open ones right?? does that mean i am not using the correct driver?
shouldnt it be fglrx or whatever its called?
that output does not show the driver name.  Only the hardware name
fglrx is the proprietary driver name
lspci -k does show driver names.  But what you posted here in the channel does not appear to list the driver in use.
so how do you check to see what driver you are currently using? to make sure you are using the propriety one?
sorry I thought that lspci -k showed that module you were currently using
lspci -k   (but sometimes that lies) the BEST way is to look at lsmod.  lsmod's output is very large so use grep
read what I said.  lspci -k  does show the driver.  But you did not paste enough of the output to show the driver name here in the channel.
oh ok.. let me have another look
oh yeah Kernel driver in use: fglrx_pci
still.. I am not happy with the driver.. the output on the 3rd monitor isnt full screen
it was with the open radeon drivers
so then use the open source drivers?
like so bad even screensavers were jumpy.. heh
well pick the one that you think is best
